monitoringPlanCommentData.monitoringPlanComment: The normal load levels were updated based on a load analysis performed on the past four quarters of data in preparation of RATAs.

The NOx analyzer on MS03D (Component ID:  043) failed on February 28th and was replaced with a spare, like kind anyzer (Component ID:  049).  Before the new anzlyzer could be certified, it too failed in service and was replaced with a second spare, like kind analyzer (Component ID:  050) on March 1st.  Component 043 was scheduled for a linearity tes,t as part of a recertification following a span/range change, when it failed.  Therefore, the recerification process could not be completed.

I certify that for the housr in which NOx lb/mmBtu data is substituted, the NOx emission controls, as needed to comply with the permit, were operating properly and that the substitute values recorded during the quarter do not systematically underestimate emissions.  I further certify that for the hours in which SO2 ppm data is substituted, the add-on SO2 emission control (i.e., FGD) was operating properly and that the substitute values recorded during the quarter do not systematically underestimate emissions.

An annual span and range evaluation was performed during third quarter, which resulted in the need to add a low range to NOx analyzers on MS03C and MS03D CEMS.  The changes were based on historical data, required the purchase of new calibration gasses and were made on October 23, 2018 hour 15.

An annual span and range evaluation was performed during third quarter, which resulted in switcing from dual ranges to single ranges of the NOx and SO2 analyzers in the MS03C and MS03D CEMS.  The changes were based on historical data, required the purchase of new calibration gasses and were made on November 27, 2017 at 0800.
The serial number for the SO2 analyzers on MS03C and MS03D (components 037 and 016) have been corrected with this submissions.

Discovered a typographical error in the new range of operation that was established for MS03D.  The range should have been 140-265, but the upper limit was mistakingly entered as 165.  The error has been corrected with this submission.
The serial number for the SO2 analyzer on MS03C (Component ID:  037) has been corrected with this submission.  It was mistakingly changedt with the November 11, 2014 submission.

The range of operation for Unit 3 (MS03C and MS03D) was updated to reflect a historical data analysis.  The new range of operation is 140-265.  In addition the NOx analyzer on this unit failed on February 28, 2018 and was replaced with a spare.  Before the spare NOx analyzer would be certified, it also failed.  A second spare analyzer was put in service on March 1, 2018, and will be certified.
The flow spans and formula text have been updated and a correction has been made to the unit stack attribute information.
Normal loads for Unit 3 is updated with this submission based on a load analysis for the four previous operating quarters.  Normal loads are now low and mid.
The submission of this Monitoring Plan includes changes to reflect MATS monitoring methodology PowerSouth will use to comply with MATS.

Like kind NOx analyzers and Flow monitors were installed on MS03C and MS03D stacks.  Recertification tests have been conducted and will be submitted before the deadline.  A load analysis for Unit 3 was performed on April 28, 2014 before the RATAs were run.  As a result, the normal and second normal load ranges have been updated in the moniroting plan.

monitoringFormulaData.formulaText: Total HI unit3 = F#(031) * T_MS03C + F#(037) * T_MS03D / T3
